Speaking in Tongues is the fifth studio album by the band Talking Heads
released in 1983.

The album was a commercial breakthrough that produced the band's first
[and only] American Top 10 hit, "Burning Down the House", which was
accompanied by a promotional video. The following tour was documented
in Jonathan Demme's Stop Making Sense, which generated a live album of
the same name. [The concert film and live album's title comes from the
repeated phrase "Stop making sense!" during the song "Girlfriend Is
Better".] In addition, the album crossed over to the dance charts,
peaking at number two for six weeks.
